# Creando secrets

- Muy similar a los ConfigMaps

>> kubectl create secret ... --from-file=---
>> kubectl create secret ... --from-literal=...

```
(base) liacob@DESKTOP-9HJ41J9:~/repos/ckad_training$ kubectl create secret generic my-secret --from-file=ssh-privatekey=/home/liacob/.ssh/id_rsa --from-literal=passphrase=paswword
secret/my-secret created

(base) liacob@DESKTOP-9HJ41J9:~/repos/ckad_training$ kubectl describe secrets my-secret 
Name:         my-secret
Type:  Opaque

Data
====
ssh-privatekey:  2610 bytes
passphrase:      8 bytes

(base) liacob@DESKTOP-9HJ41J9:~/repos/ckad_training$ kubectl get secrets my-secret -o yaml 
apiVersion: v1
data:
  passphrase: cGFzd3dvcmQ=
  ssh-privatekey: 
kind: Secret
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: "2022-04-13T16:10:15Z"
  name: my-secret
  namespace: default
  resourceVersion: "2360"
  uid: 5891ad62-95b7-4cdd-b6c2-e4c75e179f83
type: Opaque
```

- Podemos crear secretos a partir de YAML pero tenemos que codificarlos primero. 

- No olvidemos que con un:
```
 echo <string> | baes64 -d
```
Ya lo desciframos
